abstract: William C Rhoden Sports of The Times column profiles Kenny Anderson, former New York City basketball prodigy and NBA player who is now coaching at Posnack Jewish Day School in Davie, Fla; notes that Anderson, frustrated with not being able to find a satisfying college coaching opportunity, decided to move to Florida and use his love of basketball and gift for teaching it to work with young players.
snippet: The former N.B.A. star Kenny Anderson, once a New York City basketball prodigy, has a new mission as coach at a Jewish school in Florida.
lead_paragraph: The former N.B.A. star Kenny Anderson, once a New York City basketball prodigy, has a new mission as coach at a Jewish school in Florida.

headline.main: A Surprising Twist in a Career That Has Been Full of Them
headline.print_headline: A Surprising Twist in a Career That Has Been Full of Them
